Services

Wheel Alignment vs Balancing: What's the Difference?

Many people confuse these two services. Learn why both are crucial for your vehicle's performance and tyre life.

Maintenance
4 min read

Tyre Pressure: Why It Matters More Than You Think

ටයර් පීඩනය (Tyre Pressure): ඔබ සිතනවාට වඩා එය වැදගත් වන්නේ ඇයි?

Proper tyre pressure affects safety, fuel economy, and tyre lifespan. Learn how to check and maintain it.

Read More

Quick wins

Weekly Tyre Care Tips

Tip 1

කලින් පීඩනය බලන්න

මාසිකව හෝ දිගු ගමනකට පෙර සියලු ටයර් 32-35 PSI අතරදැයි බලන්න.

Tip 2

Rotation Routine

10,000km ට වරක් cross-rotation එකක් කරන්න tread unevenness අවම කරගන්න.

Tip 3

Alignment Reminder

වාහනය එක පැත්තකට ඇදෙනවාද? වහාම CCD wheel alignment කරගන්න.

Tip 4

බර සහ ගැලීම්

අතිරික්ත බර හෝ pothole impact වලින් වහාම visual crack check එකක් කරන්න.

Featured Guide

Tyre Care Blueprint (Sri Lanka)

High-humidity, stop-go Colombo traffic එකට හොඳම weekly + monthly routine එක මෙන්න.

  • Weekly: cold PSI + tread wear bar check
  • Monthly: wheel balancing + rotation log update
  • Quarterly: roadside emergency kit + spare inspection

Frequently Asked Questions

Find answers to common questions about our tyres and services

We stock a wide range of tyres including passenger car tyres, SUV tyres, van tyres, and light truck tyres from premium brands like Michelin, Bridgestone, Continental, Goodyear, and many more.

Yes! We offer professional tyre installation by certified technicians. The service includes mounting, balancing, and valve replacement. Installation is typically completed within 30-60 minutes.

Tyres should be replaced when the tread depth reaches 1.6mm (legal minimum) or after 5-6 years regardless of wear. However, if you notice uneven wear, cracks, bulges, or frequent air loss, replace them immediately.

Yes, we provide precision wheel alignment using advanced equipment. Proper alignment improves tyre life, fuel efficiency, and vehicle handling. We recommend alignment every 10,000 km or if you notice uneven tyre wear.

All our tyres come with manufacturer warranty covering manufacturing defects. Premium brands typically offer 3-5 year warranties. We also provide installation warranty for workmanship.

Your tyre size is printed on the sidewall (e.g., 195/65R15). You can also find it in your vehicle manual, inside the driver door jamb, or fuel filler cap. Use our tyre size calculator on this website for comparisons.

Currently, we recommend visiting our shop for professional installation. However, for bulk orders or special requirements, please contact us to discuss delivery options.

We accept cash, bank transfers, and all major credit/debit cards. For corporate clients, we also offer credit payment terms subject to approval.

Check for: 1) Tread depth below 3mm, 2) Visible cracks or cuts, 3) Bulges or blisters, 4) Uneven wear patterns, 5) Age over 5 years, 6) Frequent air pressure loss. If unsure, visit us for a free inspection.

While possible, it's not recommended. Different brands have different performance characteristics. Ideally, all four tyres should be the same brand and model. At minimum, front and rear pairs should match.
